title: Hunter Biden Cannot Catch a Break
description: Hunter Biden's plea deal falling apart is the latest reminder that he can't move beyond his past.

title: Mitch McConnell Leaves News Conference After Freezing Up Mid-Sentence
description: The Kentucky senator appeared to freeze up and stared vacantly for around 20 seconds before his colleagues grabbed his elbows and asked if he wanted to go back to his office.

title: The Controversial Saturday Night Live Performance That Made Sinéad O’Connor an Icon
description: The singer, who has died at 56, is remembered for her legacy as a protest artist, perhaps best exemplified by a 1992 Saturday Night Live performance that went off-script.

title: Democratic Politicians Are Embracing Barbiecore
description: While some Republicans are decrying Barbie for being woke, Democratic lawmakers are leaning into the Barbie trend.

title: Cambodia’s Long Serving Strongman Is Handing Power to His Son. The World Should Speak Up
description: The exiled leader of Cambodia National Rescue Party reflects on Sunday's sham elections and news Hun Manet will become Prime Minister.

title: How Revel Went From Electric Mopeds to Building Urban EV Charging Networks
description: How Revel went from electric mopeds to building urban EV charging networks.

title: These Are the States With the Highest Rates of Mass Shootings
description: For the first time we know what states have the highest rates of mass shootings, and most are in the South.

title: Witness Tells Congress ‘Nonhuman Biologics’ Were Found at Alleged UFO Crash Sites
description: At a congressional hearing, a witness said “nonhuman biologics” were found at alleged crash sites.

title: Extra Time: Two World Cup Champs Aren’t Scared of the Dutch
description: Christen Press and Tobin Heath preview tonight's U.S. vs. Netherlands match.

title: What Nebraska’s Sentencing of a Teen Who Used Abortion Pills Might Mean in Post-Roe America
description: These are three abortion legal areas to watch after the Celeste Burgess case, according to experts.

title: Don’t Ignore Your Climate Anxiety
description: Wildfires, record-breaking heat waves, and dangerous air quality are causing increased climate anxiety. We must own it, writes Susan Clayton.

title: What to Know About the Army Chief Who Will Be Cambodia’s Next Leader
description: After 38 years as Cambodia's Prime Minister, Hun Sen announced that his son, army chief Hun Manet, will succeed him in a few weeks.

title: Kevin Spacey Acquitted of Sexual Assault Charges in London Trial
description: A London jury acquitted Kevin Spacey of sexual assault on accusations by four men that date back to 2001.

title: Kevin Spacey Acquitted of Sexual Assault Charges in London Trial
description: A London jury acquitted Kevin Spacey of sexual assault on accusations by four men that date back to 2001.

title: A Hive Mind of Doctors Can Mean Better Care for Patients
description: When physicians collaborate in diagnosing symptoms and prescribing care results improve

title: Why Modi Is Facing a Rare No-Confidence Vote
description: The motion was brought by the opposition Congress Party amid growing outrage over the deadly ethnic conflict in Manipur.

title: Hot Tub-Level Water at Tip of Florida May Be Hottest Seawater Ever Recorded
description: The water temperature on the tip of Florida hit hot tub levels, exceeding 100° two days in a row.

title: AI Leaders Create Industry Watchdog as Government Scrutiny Grows
description: A group of tech companies including Google and OpenAI are creating an industry body to ensure that AI models are safe.

title: Cambodia’s Ruler of Four Decades Will Retire. His Son Is Set to Succeed Him
description: After nearly four decades in the power, Hun Sen is stepping down, allowing his son Hun Manet to succeed him as Prime Minister.

title: Exiled Former Leader Thaksin Shinawatra Plans Return to Thailand Amid Post-Election Chaos
description: The return of the former Prime Minister who has lived in self-imposed exile for 15 years is likely to add to the turmoil that has gripped the country in recent months as it struggles to form a new government.

title: 51 Beached Whales Died in Australia. Authorities Are Trying to Save 46 More
description: Nearly 100 pilot whales stranded themselves on a beach in western Australia Tuesday, and more than half had died by Wednesday morning.

title: Ouster of Xi’s Handpicked Foreign Minister Halts Rising Career
description: The former Chinese ambassador to the U.S. became China's shortest-ever serving foreign minister on Tuesday.
